decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to bring back multiple copies of Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent with powerful flying attackers. Pyromancer Ascension and Finale of Promise help to further fuel this graveyard strategy, while cards like Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake provide additional threats to pressure the opponent. By utilizing efficient cantrips and burn spells, this aggro deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The key concept of this deck revolves around assembling the powerful Valakut combo by ramping up mana quickly with cards like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow, while also disrupting the opponent's graveyard strategies with Relic of Progenitus. The deck focuses on controlling the board early with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Sweltering Suns, before ultimately winning the game by sacrificing lands with Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage with Valakut triggers. Primeval Titan serves as a key piece in tutoring for Valakut and ramping up the mana base.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on early disruption and removal spells to control the game while quickly deploying efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Kalitas. The deck aims to apply pressure and close out the game with powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and efficient beaters. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the deck is designed to grind out opponents with a mix of hand disruption, removal, and resilient threats. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a fast clock to win games in the mid to late game.

This UWx Midrange deck focuses on controlling the game through various removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt, while also using counterspells like Spell Queller and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes a mix of efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Geist of Saint Traft, along with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi. The mana base allows for flexibility and smooth gameplay, with options to fix colors and disrupt opponent's lands with cards like Spreading Seas and Field of Ruin. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize to lower your life total and enable Death's Shadow to become a massive threat. It also includes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to control the board while using cards like Snapcaster Mage and Kolaghan's Command for additional value. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Gurmag Angler and close out the game with cards like Temur Battle Rage. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Faithless Looting help to dig for key cards and manage the graveyard.

The deck is focused on quickly building up a board presence of Human creatures while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage. The deck aims to take advantage of tribal synergies and the mana efficiency of cards like Aether Vial and Ancient Ziggurat to apply pressure early in the game and maintain control during the mid to late game. The combination of aggressive creatures like Champion of the Parish and disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben makes it difficult for opponents to mount a defense or execute their own game plan.

This aggro deck focuses on utilizing Humans to overwhelm opponents quickly. By using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Ancient Ziggurat for mana acceleration, this deck aims to develop a strong board presence early on. Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant grow in size as more Humans enter the battlefield, while disruptive creatures like Kitesail Freebooter and Meddling Mage disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of aggressive threats like Mantis Rider and resilient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, this deck aims to apply pressure and maintain board control throughout the game.

The key focus of this UW Control deck is to establish control over the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Wrath of God, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage through card draw and filtering. The inclusion of cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Snapcaster Mage further solidifies the deck's ability to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a longer game.

The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Amulet of Vigor and Azusa, Lost but Seeking, before ultimately casting Primeval Titan to search for specific lands like Boros Garrison and Gemstone Mine to generate even more mana. Karn, the Great Creator adds utility and disruption, while Engineered Explosives and Pact of Negation provide protection. The land package includes strategic choices like Tolaria West to tutor for utility lands and Cavern of Souls to ensure important creature spells like Primeval Titan resolve. The deck's goal is to quickly assemble its combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with powerful Spirit creatures that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Collected Company and Aether Vial to efficiently put creatures onto the battlefield, while also providing disruption with cards like Spell Queller and Deputy of Detention. With key cards like Drogskol Captain and Supreme Phantom boosting the power of the Spirits, this deck aims to be aggressive and proactive in order to quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to fill the graveyard quickly with cards like Faithless Looting and Life from the Loam, allowing for explosive plays with Dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp. By utilizing cards such as Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam, the deck can quickly bring back powerful creatures like Bloodghast and Narcomoeba from the graveyard. This enables the player to overwhelm their opponent with a flurry of threats and combo potential, all while leveraging the graveyard as a resource to dominate the game.

The main concept of this deck is to use the interaction between Hardened Scales and +1/+1 counters to rapidly pump up creatures like Walking Ballista, Hangarback Walker, Arcbound Ravager, and Steel Overseer. By utilizing cards like Welding Jar, Throne of Geth, and Animation Module, the deck aims to create a resilient and aggressive board presence. Additionally, the deck includes mana acceleration and card selection tools like Mox Opal and Ancient Stirrings to ensure a consistent flow of threats. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and powerful board state.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive Human creatures while disrupting opponents with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. Cards like Aether Vial and Ancient Ziggurat help cast creatures efficiently, and Cavern of Souls protects them from counterspells. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful army of Humans, using cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to make the team even stronger. Reflector Mage and Deputy of Detention provide additional disruption and removal options.

This aggro Human deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with fast, efficient creatures. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up the team, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage. The deck's mana base is optimized for casting Humans of all colors, making it versatile and consistent in its aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence of Merfolk creatures and utilize their tribal synergy to overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost the power of all Merfolk, combined with Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, the deck aims to quickly apply pressure and close out the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan. Spreading Seas and Merfolk Trickster provide disruption and tempo advantage, while Master of Waves can create a massive army of elemental tokens to seal the victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Relic of Progenitus. The ultimate goal is to play Scapeshift to find Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and then Primeval Titan to fetch Mountains and deal huge amounts of damage to the opponent quickly. The deck focuses on efficiently assembling the Valakut combo to win the game in a powerful and explosive way.
